name: Chef Ayesha
bio: Chef Ayesha has been cooking for over 10 years and specializes in Bangladeshi cuisine. Her passion for cooking started at a young age and she has since honed her skills through training and experience.

bangladeshi_recipes.ingredients: 1 lb. chicken, 2 cups basmati rice,2 onions,3 garlic cloves,1 tsp. cumin,1 tsp. coriander, 1 tsp. turmeric, 1/2 tsp. chili powder,2 tomatoes, 1/2 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp. ghee, 2 cups water, Salt to taste
bangladeshi_recipes.instructions: Wash and soak rice in water for 30 minutes.Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat.Add onions and garlic and fry until golden brown.Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder and fry for 1-2 minutes.Add chicken and fry until browned on all sides.Add tomatoes and yogurt and stir well.Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.In a separate pot, boil 2 cups of water.Add rice and salt to the pot and stir well.Cover and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes or until the rice is tender and fluffy.In a serving dish, layer the chicken and rice, starting and ending with rice.Cover and let rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.

bangladeshi_recipes.ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour,1 tsp. salt,1 tbsp. oil, 3/4 cup water
bangladeshi_recipes.instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and oil, Slowly add water and knead the dough until it's smooth and pliable.Cover and let rest for 10-15 minutes.Divide the dough into small balls and roll out into thin circles.Heat a griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.Place the chapati on the griddle and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned and cooked through.Serve hot with your favorite curry or chutney.

bangladeshi_recipes.ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour,1 tsp. salt,1 tbsp. oil,3/4 cup water
bangladeshi_recipes.instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and oil.Slowly add water and knead the dough until it's smooth and pliable.Cover and let rest for 10-15 minutes.Divide the dough into small balls and roll out into thin circles.Heat a griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.Place the chapati on the griddle and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned and cooked through.Serve hot with your favorite curry or chutney.

name: Chef Hasan
bio: Chef Hasan is a Bangladeshi chef with over 15 years of experience in cooking traditional dishes. He has a passion for sharing his culinary knowledge and expertise with others and loves experimenting with new recipes and ingredients.
